citeinfo.origin: C. Hans Nelson, Kirk R. Johnson (Denver Museum of Natural History), John H. Barber, Jr., and Robert L. Phillips: U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Gray Whale and Walrus Feeding Excavation on the Bering Shelf, Alaska

abstract.p: Our study of side scan sonographs from the northeastern Bering Sea shows that extensive bottom disturbance is caused by benthis feeding of California gray whales and Pacific walrus. In this study, we identify the features on sonographs that result from gray whale and walrus feeding disturbance and relate their distribution to bottom-sediment types and faunal assemblages.
[Reference: Nelson, C. Hans, Kirk R. Johnson, and John H. Barber, Jr., 1987. Gray whale and walrus feeding excavation on the Bering Shelf, Alaska. Journal of Sedimentary Petrology, 57(3): 419-430.]
This journal article can be found at the University of Washington Natural Sciences Library Stacks under the Call # QE420 .J69 v,57 no,1-3 or at other university libraries.

descript.purpose: A report on gray whale and walrus feeding excavation on the Bering shelf, Alaska.
